Method.Step: In a large bowl, mix water, brown sugar and the prepared yeast.
Stir in flour gradually, a cup at a time. You have enough flour when the dough no longer sticks to the bowl.
Turn dough out onto a floured surface and knead lightly, just long enough to produce a smooth ball of dough.

To form pretzels, pinch off a piece of dough about the size of a golf ball. Roll it between your hands into a cigar shape. Keep rolling it into a long (8-10 inch) thin tube, either with your hands or on a counter top. You can either leave them straight or twist them into the typical pretzel shape (twist the dough into a loop using a single twist, then fold the loop over the twist and drape it over the loose ends -you know, a pretzel), or make it any shape you like.
Place the pretzels onto a non-stick baking sheet. When the sheet is full, remove them to the boiling water for 30 seconds.
Transfer them back to the baking sheet and sprinkle them with as much salt as you like.
Bake until golden brown, approximately 15 minutes. Best served warm.

Variations.Variation: Sprinkle with sesame seeds before baking.
Sprinkle with Everything Bagel mix before baking.
